name: Champions Online
description: Grab your cape and defend Millennium City in this comic book-style action MMORPG! Design your hero and costume from thousands of costume pieces, face super-villains like Dr. Destroyer, and create your own unique nemesis.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7 Processor: 2.5GHz Single Core or 1.8GHz Dual Core Memory: 1GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 7800 / ATI Radeon X700 or HD / Intel Graphics with Dual Core DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c Hard Drive: 5GB Free Disk Space Sound: DirectX Compatible Soundcard
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7 Processor: 2GHz Dual Core or Better Memory: 2GB RAM or Better Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8800 or Better / ATI Radeon HD3850 or Better DirectX®: ®:   DirectX 9.0c Hard Drive: 5GB Free Disk Space Sound: DirectX Compatible Soundcard

reviews.review_text: remember when your dad would dress up in spandex and shout 'I AM THE DONGMAN' at passerby? like a couple years before he broke down entirely and was carted off to an asylum? yeah this game lets you relive those days
The perfect super hero character creator of 2013.  Oh, gameplay? Yeah, it's alright I suppose.

Great MMO with great customization, different locations, worlds, enemies. Pros - events, dev support, lots of stuff to explore, character creation, different powers, role playing. Cons - grinding, grinding, grinding, grinding, furries, furries, furries, furries. 30% of players are the same ♥♥♥♥ing manimals.

1500+ hours player.  The Good: - This might just be the best Character Creator ever in a video game, period. Just browsing the costume section of the official forums reveals just how in depth you can make a character. At the very least, this is on par with CoH. Which is to say it's incredible. Too bad the game around it is rather half-♥♥♥♥♥.  - The Freeform system is awesome. Too bad if Silver (F2P) players want to use it, you have to drop 50 whole bucks.   The Bad: - The game dosen't take its self seriously in the slightest, and (on the whole) the playerbase dosen't either. For every awesome, original player who actually creates superheroes, there's always going to be 'Themeless' characters. Everything from a outragerous, over the top, aura covered mess, or someone who colours tights to give the illusion of being naked, or someone who copies Marvel/DC creations (There's an notoriously well-known supergroup who is entirely dedicated to this). It's all there.  - The Alert System was a terrible idea. They're instanced content that can be completed in about 2 minutes. Smash, Grab, and Burst alerts give out XP, Resources, and Mods respectevly. Grab alerts aren't that bad, but the mods given out by Burst alerts are almost always useless. Smash alerts are the worst offender here, because they render the entire questing process completely irrelevant. You can aquire a reasonably large amount of XP in a very short amount of time. You can reach the level cap without even leaving the starting area. Sure, there's perks (the 713 achievments) to be had in the questing process, but perk points are like gamerscore, complely useless. They don't do anything.   - Little to no Endgame. There's raids, but they BADLY NEED an revamp. There's only about 2-3 that the community are willing to do.   - Immersion in non-existant. Remember what I said about 'Themeless characters'? They are everywhere. This extends to actual builds, Where they have summoning demons, celestial powers, calling in an airstike, a massive force of kinetic energy, mind control, and dual pistols all on the same character. They have the appearance of a hyper-anime little girl who never looses a slither of health and roflstomps everything. This is like the Iron-Skin spamming Rhino Primes in Warframe, but ten-times worse. Just try to get immersed here. I dare you.  - Zone chat is a huge cancer. Disable it immedietly. You will not regret it.    Champions can be enjoyable if you're willing to overlook the player who don't know they're playing a *SUPERHERO* MMO. You can share resources and gear between your characters, and there's no armor repair system, which I see as completly pointless and meaningless. Development has turned to an almost standstill, but both it and developer communication has started up again, and quite frequently.You might find a new virtual home here, just be prepared be disapointed in some (more that others) areas.
Very fun and creative game

Champions Online is a lot of fun, and since its free to play its definitely worth a look. This isn't the kind of MMO you can waste your entire life on, but is that really such a bad thing?  This game's oddball humor and deep customization are its biggest strengths. If you're a fan of comic books who can apreciate the goofy side of superheroes this is a must try.
Although it feels like other mmos the character creation is madness and you create your own nemesis
2nd best MMORPG i've ever played. Solid questing, good group OR solo experience, and customization that will blow your mind. Also, Robot T Rex fighting King Kong on fire.

I usually steer clear of F2P games, but I have to say I don't regret giving Champions Online a quick spin. After spending an hour or two customizing your character (not kidding with this one), you'll find that the learning curve is very short and the game itself rather casual. Despite being simple in gameplay, CO is a well-made and enjoyable package.   Like most MMOs, it's a treat best shared with friends, and this time, the treat is free.

Well, they've reduced one of my biggest problems with the game. Time was, you'd have to subscribe to be able to play as a Freeform character. Freeform characters have all powers and skills unlocked, and can set up however the heck they want, making for possible combinations far far more potent than any of the pre-made builds available to free or premium players. Now you can buy the ability to permanently make Freeform characters (expensive and on a per-character-slot basis, oi vey) in the shop. Highly customizable character creation, but that's about as far as I've ever gotten, as being stuck with a permanently weak character for not subscribing was more of a psychological hurdle than I could personally deal with. Not familiar enough with the game for a score.
My favorite online Dress-Up Sim.
This is a fun game. ONe of its best attributes is how easy is to join friends of any level to play together.
Epic concept, boring gameplay. Nuff said.

This game stagnated. Went stale. Really stale. Cryptic sold it to PWE, and it started churning out vehicles and a bunch of reskins for the vehicles. It became lockbox mania. Every other kill, you'd get a lockbox.   Then they stopped, pulled it together, and turned the game back in the right direction: more actual content, fewer lockboxes cluttering your inventory.   The lockboxes are once again in your inventory, but they don't drop like nuts. The long-demanded purchasable free form slots are around now, at a hefty $50 but hey, we've paid more for smaller games. I should also mention, now including the adventure packs but not a few other things, the game is free. You can play through the whole thing from level 1 to 40. No experience penalties for being a free account or anything (I'm looking at YOU, SWTOR). The main drawback is that you HAVE to use an archetype, and only from a select list - you don't get to pick your own powers as you go without buying a freeform slot or paying the subscription. However, given the a large number of MMOs don't really let you pick your own powers from a very broad set, it should feel pretty normal. In fact, it's kind of nice not having to worry about all the choices, because the already large powers list has only gotten bigger over time. Start of playing for free, for sure, until you get a hang of the game.   Old updates like the 10-man boss 'Rampage' events have recently been re-done. The old teleportation glitch is still around, though. At the end of a teleport, you get slow fall for ten seconds. If you fly or teleport while slowfall is active, you will be dragged to the ground. Surely they can just make teleportation and flight powers cancel out slow fall when they're first cast... Anyways. Costumes. How badass you look will have nothing to do with your stats and will often have very little to do with special gear cluttering your important slots. There are some pieces of equipment that give you a special dark aura, or dark speed, stuff like that, but they don't take up your equipment slots. Costumes are 100% cosmetic with a quite wonderful selection even for free players. With a subscription, you get a bunch more costumes thrown in and a 500 Zen/month stipend you can go ahead and just buy those extra costumes with. And with the game's rather open lore (though it does exist), roleplay is hard to resist.   ...just remember to bring a friend into the game with you. Leveling can start too feel a little too much like a grind around the 20th time you level through Westside. And yes, I've gone through Westside that many times. Also, if you play this, tell Poe Ghost hello. He's pretty scaley. And then tell the rest of the people Poe sent you.

Champions Online is hours of unlimited fun, I mean C'mon who doesn't like superheros ;)  Character customization is great and has lots to offer!  The gameplay is amazing that I cant even describe, With all those travel abilities and skills and more...... if you already liked DC Univarse you gonna love this!  my only problem that the game crashing my pc after like 20 minutes playing, no idea why. but i totally like this game, and reccomand it to all superhero fans! :D

Character Creator (THE BEST EVER!) Story (Good, Better with friends) Tutorial (Good for Beginners) Combat (Hard at first but gets easier later) Bosses (Difficult unless Higher Level, Stocked Up, or with friends)  I love this game and love playing it with friends, didnt reach far though but I am so gonna have fun making my personal enemy :D

Champions Online was the first MMO I played that derailed the World of Warcraft Juggernaut for me, and that's back when it was pay to play. Combat is dynamic, fast paced and a lot less about rotation and more about situation and play style. Obviously as F2P it has limitations. Less costume pieces, set archetypes rather then fully customised power choices and some additional content are either gold account or microtransaction accessible.  Character customisation is currently unparelled, I prefer it to City of Heroes, the only thing that comes close.  I admit that I jumped in face first, subscribing and buying a few costume packs. The gold subscription unlocks everything but a few costume bits, you even get a free token for one of the new hideouts. You can play through the game from start to endgame without paying anything and free is a reasonable price for that. Finally, there's an active Roleplaying community.  Better then the critic score gives it credit for.
This game is the best! :D  Awesome gameplay, graphics and the community is amazing.
The game is super fun when you lvl up to 40 and you can do almost anything.....SO PLAY IT and its free!!!

(NOTICE! This game has many abilities and costume pieces you must BUY with their Real Money Currency, AKA, '0Zen' or have the super pricy Lifteme Membership to get access to. Even without those costume pieces, this game is still awesome, but just remember, You get what you pay for. And it's a F2P, or an Optional Subscription, or a Buy a lifetime of subscription)   Even though it says I've only played a few hours, I've played this game since long before it was on steam, and it was awesome every, single step of the way.  The first thing that was awesome? The Character Customization! I made a character that looks like Jack from ME2, a Karate Bird Man, A 4 ft. tall ninja, a rat called 'Cheese Inc.', a giant Robot Raptor Mech with Orange Holographic Armor, and giant metal wings. Equipping armor doesn't change your character's appearance, so you never have to worry about being forced to wear the ugliest gloves on earth, or a skirt (hint hint, Blizzard Entertainment. HINT HINT!!!)  The second thing? The Ability Customization! I have a character called 'The Everything Man'. He just looks like a normal dude with a really huge backpack. He then whips out dual pistols and shoots you 15 times, shoots a sonic arrow from his Hi-Tech Laser Bow, hits you with a fireball, summons a telekinetic sword and dices you up, then swings away on a rope. And it's a totally viable build. Also, you can change the color of your abilites, and you can even change where some come from (from a select list, not wherever you choose... so dont get any ideas...) You can shoot red colored ice shards from your chest, or green fire balls from your face, or even purple wind gusts out your fists Whatever you want.  Third on the list we have... The Travel Powers! You can swing on a rope, you can teleport, you can fly (with a cape, with giant firey phoenix wings, whatever. Its up to you.), You can tunnel underground and pop up under your enemies, you can Superjump, You can zip around the world with Superspeed. You can float about on a giant hunk of rock, or spin about in a tornado. ANYTHING!!! And all of those were just off the top of my head! Also, there are probably 6 different forms of flight to choose from, so you'll probably have one you like.  Fourth, Combat. Its fun and intuitive. At the same time (like, omg!). You can do what I did and just throw together something crazy and it'll work, or you can really read into every ability and make a crazy build that causes all kinds of combos to happen that heal you, buff you, etc. One thing that was a *SLIGHTLY* bad thing, was that enemies always fall facefirst when they die, unless you kill them with a knockback, wherein they will die face up, but it doesn't really matter that much.  Last but not least, the community. I'll give an(other). There is a guild that throws a weekly Costume Contest and rewards the winners with the equivalent of 100 Gold, and they even have honorable mentions that get 50 Gold. Crazy huh!? I know!!! And all of its in a F2P (NOTE!!! You get what you pay for, so some things will be locked off if you dont pay a subscription or get a Lifetime membership, which, last I saw, was really pricey.) But still, even the F2P version has quite a few different things you can do.  Have Fun, and Download this game!   Well, come on, do it! DOWNLOAD IT! SERIOUSLY!! DO IT NOW MON, DO IT NOW!!!
It's the only game that lets me play a Soviet Bear Wrestler. Therefore, best game ever.

I've played this game on and off since 2011. The amount of customization available to really personalize my hero makes the game fun and enjoyable to come back to. I keep it installed on all my computers for when I get the urge to get down on some superhero gameplay. Champions may not have as much dimension as other MMOs but it's still a good time.

The combat is simple and it translates well to a controller as well, but what really brings me back is my lifetime subscription.

Pretty good for a F2P MMORPG. Unique setting, extensive character customization, and loads of fun to be had, even without spending money.  I would recommend getting either a Gold subscription or buying a freeform character slot once they're 50% off, as it really unlocks the game's full potential.

Blue IronMan ?

Its crazy fun selecting what your character looks like. In fact, thats where my first 3 hours game time is spent! But instantly when you join the game, the graphics change to something not quite as good looking, but it is easily over looked.  It seems all starting characters are about as equally tough in comparison to each other. The tank doesn't seem anymore of a tank than a ranged character seems ranged. I feel like the game is supposed to take classes into account when you reach level 10. But why not let us play starting from level 10 then?   On the same note, other games make you go to level 60, but this stops at 40. So why didn't they just strip off the first 10 levels of grinding too? Just to be sure, I want you to know that I am not complaining there aren't a million levels to grind. My complaint is that if they had the foresight to remove the last 20 level grind, why didn't they also remove the first 10 level grind too?  The worst part, is that it seems that your powers and skills are no different from anyone else playing the same class. Your personal touch is left to how your character looks. Your character's uniqueness stops once you choose your class. Basically setting your character in stone once you leave character creation.   UPDATE:

Have you ever read a comic book and thought, 'I could make a better superhero than that!'? Well, now you have your chance.* Champions is an MMO that offers everyone a chance to make thier own heroes and beat the snot out of villains, goons, and aliens alike. Half the fun is in just playing with the costume maker and seeing what you can produce. It's free to try, so why not see what YOU can come up with?  *Disclaimer, game does not include tragic backstory or horrible mutations.

Champions Online: Free For All is a MMO based around a city which is full of super heroes (and villains). There are several large maps you can switch between as you level up which keeps things fresh and interesting.   The 'best' feature of this game for MOST players is the really detailed character creation. You can pick from literally thousands of parts/clothing options/weapons and customise them by changing their colours, details and what they are made of (most items can at least be cloth/leather/metal and some have even more choices). Characters tend to look quite unique ALTHOUGH everyone does have the same face which is a bit annoying. There is lots of freedom for making your dream hero, though.  The community itself is still generally thriving and while there aren't as many people playing as there have been in the past, the numbers are fairly steady and will probably grow as it's almost summer and lots of extra spare time will be available. Now would be a good time to join.  The game looks nice, runs well on most machines and is interesting enough to hold your attention. It's not a terribly 'grindy' game - you level up often enough that you won't get bored but it doesn't feel too fast either.  Check it out, it's free.

Well, It's an MMO. But the Game is Great, the Customization is Amazing, You can make a Large-Boobies Chick, Or even a Weak ♥♥♥♥, The Action is Amazing, I played 'till Level 12, And ♥♥♥♥! 'This ♥♥♥♥ is ♥♥♥♥ing Amazing!' Well... That's all Folks.

Fun F2P comic book based MMO that keeps a player engaged and involved. Good sense of community and a game that doesn't mind poking fun at it's own genre. Recommended!

A superhero MMO best experienced with friends.  Even in the free-to-play portion (also known as Silver members), the costume system has the greatest degree of customization that I've ever seen in an MMO (and you can unlock a number of pieces through certain events - let me state that content the F2P crowd can unlock is a GREAT idea that every MMO should have). The game's item shop (the C-store) has a little bonus content, but most of the shop items are quality-of-life benefits.  That being said, the archetype system is a little confining (and allegedly more thematic than functional, according to at least a few Gold members I've talked to) and the true freeform development is only available to those who pay a monthly fee (the Gold members).  I'd say plunk down a few bucks for a hideout and more inventory space and don't worry about any monthly subscription unless you're planning on this being the only game you play.  Even then, be aware that Cryptic is unlikely to fix any further bugs with this game, even the ones that have been around for several years. I'd argue this one is dying.
A really good MMO if you forget the sometimes flustrating bugs but they are removed really fast.
Very cool, Be your own HERO!!
Awesome game. Great graphics and animations. and comic book style is really great. More so when you play through a comic series and actually see comic strips. Very epic game.

A really good MMORPG!

Pros: Best character customization in any game ever.  The appearance of your character is unaffected by your gear, leaving you free to take full advantage of the character customization.  Controls are easy.  Travel powers take much of the tedium out of exploring and look showy too.  Most types of build can be made from any of multiple themes, and subscribers can mix and match almost any conceivable combination of powers.  Cons: Free-to-Play allows almost no power customization after choosing the initial framework.  Very little end game content.  Grinding the last few levels is very tedious  Summary: It's free. Download it and make random characters. Fly around, maybe shoot some fire balls. It's a great game for casual mayhem.

IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A SUPER HERO GAME, WITH ORIGINAL CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION, FREE TO PLAY, THAN YOUR AT THE BEST PLACE.   Awesome game. Great customization. You can have spaces in your name, (more than once!) And you can use your mic, also can go in groups. Awesome cities with citizens, and everything. Multiplayer missions, fight super villains. Leveling isn't hard, comical, Great storyline.   You can litterally make a character in the game, and it won't look like other players characters. That's how great you can customize your characters. This game is verry awesome. I reccomend it for any age group.   Reasons to play: + My Favorite Game At The Moment + Great customization + Original Powers + Fight Crime + PVP  + Easy Leveling + Flying Jets, etc. + Names with more than 1 space. + Names are never taken (Even though many players!) + Great servers + Not much lag for very lacking computers + Great quality + Can play in low quality if your computer lacks graphics card + Free to play + Exploring the game can't be more fun + Interactive Story Lines + Original Powers, could be the same class style hero as others, yet be completley diffrent. + Just a AWESOME Game. + Buy stuff in game to make game MORE FUN! + Easy to win in pvp even if you don't pay for items. It's a very fair pvp game, (when choosing to pvp.)    I GIVE THIS GAME A 10/10.   PLEASE CHECK THIS GAME OUT! IT'S AWESOME!

I can't think of a better hero game out there right now. There isn't much admittedly for other games to choose from, but with the great customization this game offers you really can do what you want. I have been able to create such a variety of characters here its a pleasure to play. Some aspects of the game can get competitive but with a game like this its what you make of it not what it gives you.
fantasic but tbh its apay to play as the standard game doesnt give you enough power to kill the free formed players

A superhero MMO best experienced with friends.  Even in the free-to-play portion (also known as Silver members), the costume system has the greatest degree of customization that I've ever seen in an MMO (and you can unlock a number of pieces through certain events - let me state that content the F2P crowd can unlock is a GREAT idea that every MMO should have). The game's item shop (the C-store) has a little bonus content, but most of the shop items are quality-of-life benefits.  That being said, the archetype system is a little confining (and allegedly more thematic than functional, according to at least a few Gold members I've talked to) and the true freeform development is only available to those who pay a monthly fee (the Gold members).  I'd say plunk down a few bucks for a hideout and more inventory space and don't worry about any monthly subscription unless you're planning on this being the only game you play.  Even then, be aware that Cryptic is unlikely to fix any further bugs with this game, even the ones that have been around for several years. I'd argue this one is dying.

Champions Online is an awesome MMORPG brought to you by Cryptic Studio's initially the game had many issues but after a year of patching and updates its in a league of its own its also free to play meaning you get access to all the content in the game (except 3 adventure packs) a wide varity of costume parts and selection of 1 of serveral superhero archtypes.   if anyone enjoys comic books or rescuing the odd civillian in destress then try it out again its free to play!
Very good game but you need membership to have fun.

Chances are, if you've played City of Heroes/Villians or DC Universe Online, then you should know what to expect from this game. The character creation in this one is pretty deep from what I can see and the range of power progression is top-notch. Of course, there is a bit of a learning curve which begins to ramp upward with each and every passing level until you finally hit the level cap. Despite the fact that this game might be a ripoff of those two well known franchises, the fact remains that this is one game that shouldn't be missed, whether you're a hardcore gamer looking to get away from WoW or you're a casual gamer and just want to run around like crazy looking for people to hang out with. If you like it, then by all means, keep playing. Of course, as a Silver account person with this game, there's only so much that you can do before you decide to pony up some cash and upgrade to a Gold account. Regardless of which, this is still one game you should at least try out.
i play this only for the customization

The most fun I've had in an MMO in a long time. I've played just about every MMO out there, but this is the first one where it has enticed me to play so frequently since my first days of MMOs. It's definitely not perfect, and needs some polish. But despite it all, it's just plain fun! From gaining travel powers at level 5, to being able to pick and choose from different frameworks to make a unique character, it gets the larger feel of the pnp champions game right. And the costume creator is of course a great draw. I thoroughly enjoy it, and would recommend that anyone who likes City of Heroes give it a try.

Champions Is by far the best Superhero based MMO on the market right now. It has a in depth plot line that will not get repetitive as the game progress. The character customization is very expansive but the power pull and ability are lacking in Free mode. its well worth the money to buy the game and have unlimited use of mixing and matching you're power list.
It is certainly not for everyone, but the character creator alone has entertained me for longer than many other games.

I have played this game before, just recently got it on steam - hence the time spent  The character creation is probably the best I've ever seen in any FTP MMORPG title yet. It's so diverse and there are just so many choices to choose from, I loved it. Literally most of the time I spent in the game was character creation. On other things, it's quite an average mmorpg, typical for the genre, however quite fun. It doesnt bring anything innovative when it comes to gameplay (maybe besides throwing things - that's cool). The aspect that you can explore a rather large world is very nice, I enjoyed that a lot. Cool quests, not very repetitive - the world isnt as interactive as I'd perhaps like, but it's fine.     PROS    Great character creation Nice, large world Quests arent repetetive Fun combat Large selection of customizable classes to choose from Open Quests    CONS    You dont see your full costume straight away Has fairly annoyijng p2w aspects You can't select a special power that you get from the start (I mean flying, of course I do) Gets a bit grindy at stages  Overall I give this a solid 79/100, One of the best MMOs out there today, definetly wortha try if you're into superheroes and badass looking helmets

Champions Online  (CO) is my first MMO game and I've played it since 2011 (with breaks every now and then) before I got myself a Steam-account some years later.  I used to play it a lot before the  On Alert  update: I loved the old tutorial mission where I got a chance to fight side by side with the original Champions. I enjoyed the story archs, the Hero Games PvP (where lots of players joined the different games) and I really liked the crafting system.  CO changed (a lot) after the update - some people say to the worse, others aren't too affected by it. The Adventure Packs which used to be Premium missions are now free, there are new missions and new features to the Millennium City map while some of the old ones are removed. I miss the Hero Games PvP-duels which are quite abandoned today since players more or less play the co-op Alert-missions instead. But in the end, it's the same game with the same Champions as before.  Maybe I'm old-fashioned because I miss the old game before the update. But I still love it. While I don't have much time today compared with 5 years ago, I think CO is one of those games which have aged well (despite its cons).  I hope that I may continue to play the game in five more years (at least) from today. It's one of the best superhero MMO where you can create your own superhero/superheroine and play as them with a keyboard.

Okay, so, Champions Online. I'm just gonna ramble about this, because I can't be bothered being neat and succinct with it.    TL;DR:  Game's dead.   EDIT:  Yes, I have a lot of hours clocked on this game. I basically use this title as a more populated version of Paragon Chat. I log in, I screw around or roleplay for a bit, then log off. I rarely, if ever, actually use this software as an actual video game. It's a chat client at this point. I've been at this game since 2011, and I'd wager 2/3rds of that playtime was just me being AFK or RP'ing.    (Now Onto the Point...)

It's a tough call as to whether to recommend this game, because if you miss City of Heroes as much as I do, this is really your only option.   The problem is that it was taken over by Perfect World Entertainment, who is notorious for buying decent-but-struggling games and then running them into the ground. This is the case here. No real development, for years. No real new content. No significant fixes or balance passes. Very little new art. Just gamble boxes and regurgitated assets on the cash shop. Even the occasional new system or pointless tutorial revamp is just shuffling existing content around.  And for the love of god, don't blow your money on boxes. In fact, I'd say like 9 out of every 10 costumes, auras, powers, etc. I've ever bought with real money (or even in-game grind currency), I've been disappointed with -- ranging from 'mildly let down' to 'it just doesn't work at all'.   It's not that the core game loop isn't fun. It's that what little they do is always half-baked, broken, grindy, and nerfed into impotence. Greedy to the point of being hostile.  PWE is where games with potential go to die. I'll grant that it's better than the closest alternative, DC Universe Online. Just don't expect to find a thriving, well-maintained, developing game.    TL;DR

This game had a lot of potential. I played all the way back into late alpha testing, when some of the forum goers were allowed to join the tests. It was a great game back then. The problem was, that the part of the community that yelled the loudest, always got their way. 'The squeaky wheel gets the oil.' Well, the truth was, that if 15 people said something one way, and 3 said it another way, but those 3 kept ranting and raving while the 15 said 'forget this, these people are just flaming everyone' then the 3 got their way. Strange, but true.  So, the game got hammered with stupid changes that made the average player unable to play at all. This gave the game a bad start, but those things got fixed. Over time, the bad start took it's toll financially, and Cryptic Studios had to switch publishers. The new publisher, Perfect World Entertainment, is notorious for the garbage they make. What's more, is regardless of what the devs may say, it's pretty obvious that the direction of the game changed pretty fast. More half-nude women, lockboxes, pay to win style upgrades and boosts, and more made their way into the game. Currently, the most powerful opponent the players can face is Gravitar, a women that epitomizes both the ditz and the... female dog... in every way they can. That means that instead of someone like Dr. Destroyer, we get a sexual icon for a villain now. This is just the tip of the iceberg, but it's one of many reasons why this game has gone down the drain.  If you want a good superhero MMORPG, you're probably out of luck. City of Heroes was killed by NCSoft's desire for more money. DCUO is great, if you want to be a sidekick. Marvel Heroes is a Diablo II clone, if you like that sort of thing. And Champions Online? Well, if you avoid lockboxes, boosts, alerts, vehicles, and anything put in after PWE took over, then it's actually a good game. Most people won't play that way though, which means I can't recommend this game. I still have my lifetime subscription that I got myself suckered into buying, though, so I'll still come back from time to time, just to have a change of pace. After all, I haven't spent a cent on this game since launch, and I still have full VIP features still. For anyone new, though, watch out. This one had potential, but it was squandered by a few really bad decisions, and now it's just another pay to win style 'free to play'.  Oh, and if you do play, make sure you study hard on the powers. Get the wrong power combinations, and you've just become the Super Wimp. So much for roleplay. =/

Champions Online is a free-to-play superhero MMORPG. The character creation tool is pretty neat, and even though the game doesn't have any licensed characters, you can still have the powers of nearly any Marvel or DC hero. Unfortunately, CO borrows heavily from World of Warcraft, and the gameplay really suffers a a result. The quests are long, boring, and often involve killing some number of a specific monster. The tutorial is terrible: it's useless, mandatory, and way too long. The controls just don't make sense for this type of game. The characters and story are uninteresting. The graphics are kind of neat, though, since they have a strong comic book feel.  This game is surpassed by DC Universe Online in nearly every way. If you're interested in this sort of game, check out DCUO instead.

I downloaded it from Steam, no problem. Then I signed up and created my character. Then I played for about a week, and really enjoyed the game. Then it happend.  I actually got a virus on my computer from it, I can't blame the guys who made the game, but what the actual f*ck! I got it when I tried to do an ingame purchase, it redirected me to another page, I just assumed it was legit, and boom 2 days later: Computer crashed after I tried to uninstall the game. I can't say that i'm 100% sure this was the reason, however I did play this game the same day after Windows firewall had blocked it 3 times. I closed the game down and tried to open it again, however the game decided to not open, so naturally I tried to fix it, after several tries I decided I had to uninstall it and reinstall it.  it was a great game while I played it, but to this day I still have trust issues with this game. such a shame..

Just.. not worth it any more, i was one of the first of thousands to go gun ho over this game but as many of the reviewer's stated its.. just not worth it any more you get in, you make your character, right away the difference is obvious you are given i believe 3 difference classes or ( power sets) not realy even that honestly its just a class that some developer descided you'd like, you pick one you customize your appearance, 2nd problem most of the good attire and customizations require micro transaction a 10.00 spend for very little so you picked your pyro class, your made some carbon copy hot head, now its time to play, wich you now get to enjoy the tutorial the only part of this game that sadly even has a descent storyline any more for free, it hooks you in you run through the city destroying insectoids and now welcome to the game, do the first 8 quests then que up for alerts until your 30, all the while having pre picked skills inserted into your character. that is your Free to play expierence in a nutshell unless...  you descide to buy a freeform char token for 50.00 or subscribe for the monthly subscription and oh wait look at all the new things you can do the freedom! the customizations! you try that combo, mixing and matching powers to your hearts content, trying out all the costumes you had your eye on, your character looks and feels awsome finally its time to save the world of champions online right?... wrong do the tutorial once more, que up for 8 quests, hit lvl 5 or 15 wichever, then que up for alerts once more, sure the ability to pick and choose what you want because now you pay for the game is fun.. but ultimately even that 15 a month does not give you everything so you buy this little flight power.. or that little custome travel power... maybe that one extra costume.. or exansion before you know it you've spent over 50.00 your first month and you have nothing to show for it..  whats sad is ive always dreamed of descent superhero games.. i love the idea of it.. and anybody who mentions DC universe... leave just go now,.. there is just no good hero games any more and champions realy could of been it had soo much potential in the old days but like most of the devs of game, the moment a big shot company offers money to buy it out, the creators could not wait to take the money and grease themselves up like some overzealous pig races, and so like everything else Perfect World Entertainment purchases, it becomes microtranactions and prostitution based game play so please if anybody descides to play this.. read the reviews the ones with the thumbs down are not lieing, this game realy is a horrid piece of trash that could of been great.. but fell far.. very far.

Sit on a cactus. You feel that? Believe it or not what you just did is more fun (and less painful) than playing Champions Online.  After my beloved City of Heroes got shut down I decided to try this thing. Played it for a solid month and got bored before that month was up. It has the most tedious combat of any MMO I have ever played. All attacks auto hit, no real strategy to speak of. Just stand and button mash. In CoH you could strategize by enhancing powers with damage, accuracy, range etc. There was the chance attacks would miss. You had to be careful what to use and when. Here it's just pew, pew, pew mindlessly.  I wanted a telekinetic character. It's bloody annoying to throw one single object. Click the object, click to lift, click on target, click to throw! Click, click, click, click for one attack that won't even one shot an even level trash mob! The mechanics of this game are boring and a chore.  Most content is stuck behind the pay wall. Problem is that unlike DC Universe Online (where a sub can be worth it) you'd just be paying for a boring game rather than playing a boring game for free. I've no idea what the Marvel MMO is like but if you want to be a hero play DC Universe Online or simply mourn COX's demise.  The only one tiny good thing about this game is the sheer choice of travel powers. Not worth it. Sod the cactus, stick a fork in your eye. Still less painful than Champions Online.

I started out loving this game. Tons of fun to be had, and some very interesting people to meet. Now, after being around for a while, I've changed my mind.  The community in this game pretends to be nice and loving, but the minute you say something they don't agree with, you're thrown to the curb and become a pariah.   Not to mention that the new company that took over makes it incredibly hard to reactivate your old accounts. That's a real kick in the ♥♥♥ for someone that's been playing it for years. I paid for a month subscription to check out as much of the full game as I could. I spent nearly two hours building my hero, making sure not to use pieces that cost Zen (there is a large pop up in the right corner that tells you that you're using a piece that cost Zen, so it's obvious when you are). I get in game, and my entire hero is changed. Everything but base colors and the chest emblem. I log out, delete him, and start over, and now all the pieces I used now cost Zen for some reason, so I can't make the hero I want, even though I'm paying a monthly subscription fee.  So, now, I am waiting on support to give me a refund on my subscription fee (my gold subscription was open for a total of .06 days according to my account page). The rep told me he was 'reviewing my account,' and it's been over 20 minutes with no word on what's going on.  I remember when this game first came out, and it was a lot of fun. It may still be, but I'll never know. If you want access to everything, you have to pay a monthly sub fee, AND buy/collect Zen in game (and you need a LOT of Zen to unlock everything). To hell with that.
